channel.title: Well everyone should love this
channel.description:
It's hard to find two vehicles that are more different -- a pickup truck and a Formula 1 racing car. But now Ford is suing Ferrari over the use of the name F150, which both vehicles share. Ford F-150, America's top-selling truck for 33 years, probably won't be easily mistaken for a Ferrari.CAPTIONBy Ford, WieckFord uses it on its F-Series pickups, the nation's best selling vehicles. The F-150 is the most popular in the lineup. Ferrari has named its new Formula 1 racing car the "F150" as well. Hey, at least Ferrari can argue there is no hyphen. Ford contends in a lawsuit filed in Detroit that Ferrari's use of the name is blantant trademark infringement, the Associated Press reports. It probably didn't help matters that Ferrari has also created a website, www.ferrarif150.com . Ford is asking the court to stop Ferrari's use of the name. Ferrari isn't responding yet, but we imagine it was aware of Ford's unhappiness even before yesterday's court filing. It contends that the name f150 is firmly rooted in Italian history. The website says the name refers to the 150th anniversary of the unification of Italy.
The Story: http://content.usatoday.com/communities/driveon/post/2011/02/ford-sues-ferrari-over-use-of-the-name-f-150/1 Yeah.....

item.title: Well everyone should love this
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I’m sorry but how retarded are Ford to think that this will affect them in any way whatsoever. Before this was posted I had no clue about Ferrari’s plans of developing a formula one car to mark the 150th anniversary of the unification of Italy, I doubt many other people knew either and they are just gaining everyone’s attention with this lawsuit.

It’s not like Ferrari decided to pull the name out of the blue without any consideration, they have used the F prefix for many cars, F40, F50 etc so it makes complete sense to use it to mark a 150 year old occasion.

I’m echoing basically everything that has been already said, but this is seriously just another pathetic attempt of an american company to sue someone…

Read full topic

item.title: Well everyone should love this
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Moparisthebest:

So you think if Ford stole a Ferrari name, Ferrari wouldn’t care about it? They would sue as well.

We’re talking about an F1 Car and a pickup truck.

I doubt they’d care if it had happened the other way round. Of course I can’t presume.

http://en.espnf1.com/ferrari/motorsport/story/40494.html

Follow up story.

Read full topic

item.title: Well everyone should love this
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:17, topic:382428”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=478224.msg3500759#msg3500759 date=1297719728]
Apple did it to Cisco… twice…
[/quote]

Huh? Apple pay Cisco to use the iOS name.[/quote]

Yes. But the way they go about it, appears like they’ve chosen the name and then go and ask if they can use it. It is probably naive of me to think that is actually how it happens, but these deals always came out in such a way that it gives that impression.

item.title: Well everyone should love this
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:9, topic:382428”]One day you Americans will learn the rest of the world doesn’t give a shit about suing someone someone every time they have an issue with something. Why can’t they just talk to Ferrari?

Almost as bad as Apple thinking they can stomp on ITV with their iTV just because they’re a big bad corporation. Only a few hundred - sometimes maybe a thousand of every Ferrari ever get made and sold, this does absolutely negative nothing to Ford. If they were both a super-car maybe it would matter. The fact one is an F1 car, and will never hit a public market, makes this lawsuit totally idiotic.[/quote]

Apple did it to Cisco… twice… and they’re certainly bigger than ITV :P. Besides, the name of their Apple TV being ‘iTV’ was just rumour.

Read full topic

item.title: Well everyone should love this
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:5, topic:382428”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=478224.msg3500315#msg3500315 date=1297670064]

F150 != F-150. And, unless you didn’t read far enough, they have a legitimate reason for using 150.

^ If Vanilla Ice can get away with copying Queen, I think this would pass.

It’s close enough to still constitute copyright (or trademark?) infringement, regardless of if it is their 150th anniversary. It’s spoken the same way, and if you just heard F150 you would have no way of knowing which was which.
[/quote]you can tell they are talking about the pickup because of their redneck accent[/quote]I wish you didn’t get to it before me.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Obviously Ford has been using F-150 heavily for a very long time, regardless of the fact that you can’t confuse a Ferrari and a pickup truck, Ferrari can’t just come along and start using the same name.

Personally I hate Ferrari and Ford, but Ford is in the right here.

Read full topic
